text: The Hanged Man's House (in French: La maison du pendu, Auvers-sur-Oise) is an 1873 oil on canvas painting by Paul Cézanne. The painting is exhibited at the Musée d'Orsay in Paris. The Hanged Man's House was presented at the first Impressionist exhibition in 1874 and was the first painting that Cézanne sold to a collector. The village depicted in the painting is Auvers-sur-Oise, 27 km north of Paris. ==References== Category:Paintings by Paul Cézanne Category:1873 paintings Category:Landscape paintings Category:Paintings of the Musée d'Orsay
title: The Hanged Man's House
